news_header: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi are co-chairing the 7th Intergovernmental Consultations (IGC) in New Delhi, focusing on deepening cooperation between India and Germany.
news_text: Chancellor Olaf Scholz of Germany and Prime Minister Narendra Modi of India are co-chairing the 7th Intergovernmental Consultations (IGC) in New Delhi, which aims to enhance bilateral cooperation. Scholz, who arrived in India with several ministers, emphasized the need for increased collaboration during the 18th Asia Pacific Conference of German Business. The consultations, spanning two days, will involve discussions on various sectors, including defense, as Germany seeks to strengthen its strategic partnership with India. Modi highlighted the significance of the 25-year India-Germany strategic partnership and the evolving relationship, which has shifted from economic focus to strategic collaboration. Key topics for discussion include economic ties, climate change, security, and leveraging India's young talent.
